The cities of Urbandale, Clive and West Des Moines, Iowa have teamed up to provide joint Animal control Services as well as joint licensing of dogs and cats. The threee cities have adopted the same ordinance for fees and penalties for animal control. We contract with an outside vendor to provide collection services for the fees.

answers.author: Haley Kadish
answers.text:
Catawba County, NC collaborates with other jurisdictions to deliver many services.  Here are a few examples: 
Dedicated fiber network strands were installed connecting the local governments of Catawba County, Newton, Conover, Maiden, Hickory, Claremont, and Long View.   
Catawba County partners with Hickory, Conover, Newton, Maiden, Long View, Claremont, Mooresville, and Burke and Lincoln counties to extend water and sewer service to the County’s unincorporated areas.  Many municipalities partner to operate the utility plants and distribution systems  
Hickory, Conover, and Catawba County are part of a consortium created to manage the Regional Sludge Management Facility.  Catawba County contracts its portion of the facility capacity to Claremont and Maiden.   
The Catawba County EcoComplex is a partnership between Catawba County government, North Carolina Universities, businesses, and NGOs to promote, implement, and incubate green energy and sustainable technologies.  The goals of the EcoComplex are to reduce the county’s landfill operating costs, waste volume, and waste processing as well as to convert waste into productive resources.  (www.catawbacountync.gov/ecocomplex) 
Catawba County Public Health partners with Catawba Pediatrics Associates to provide health care to all children, regardless of their ability to pay. 
Catawba County partners with Hickory, Newton, Conover, and Claremont municipalities to provide a Community Alert System to supplement information individuals receive from the media and local officials during large-scale emergencies.  The system is able to send email and text message alerts to registered citizens. 
The Special Tactics and Response (STAR) Team is a collaboration that brings together Maiden, Newton, Conover, Long View, and Catawba County to handle dangerous situations and search efforts. 
Catawba County is collaborating with Hickory, Conover, Maiden,  Brookford, Catawba, Claremont, Long View, and Newton to provide consolidated permitting services for citizens.   
“Catawba Communities” cable television program highlights programs and services of Claremont, Conover, Hickory, Maiden, Newton, Catawba County, Hickory Public Schools, Newton-Conover City Schools, Catawba Valley Community College, Keep Catawba County Beautiful, Catawba County Economic Development Corporation, and Greater Hickory Convention and Visitor’s Bureau. 
Catawba, Alexander, Burke, and Caldwell counties partnered with Hickory, Newton, and Conover to create the Greenway Public Transportation Authority, which consolidated urban-rural transit service.   
Catawba County partners with Conover, Maiden, Claremont, and Hickory to deliver library services throughout the county. 
I hope this is helpful!

answers.author: Mikal Barnett
answers.text:
The cities of Kennewick, Pasco, and Richland, WA along with several fire districts have collaborated in the specification, purchase, and management of fire department personal protective equipment and uniforms.  Common standards have been agreed-to and we have realized financial benefits with greater purchase-power.  We have also developed a similar process for the management of our self contained breathing apparatus (SCBA), spare cylinders and compressors.  We developed a group made up of personnel from each agency and have once again have seen significant benefits in the purchase and maintenance of a common SCBA while simultaneously increasing our effectiveness accross the region with common training and equipment.

author: Cheryl Hilvert
text:
ICMA's new Center for Management Strategies is seeking examples of jurisdictions that are actively involved in collaborative service delivery. This will be one of the leading practice areas that the Center will be focused on in the near future. 
For the purpose of this inquiry, collaborative service delivery can be public-public partnerships; regional/shared delivery of service; privatization of services, and other examples where jurisdictions work collaboratively in delivering service to their communities, customers and stakeholders.
If you know a good example of collaborative service delivery, we would appreciate your sharing it!  Thank you!
title: Looking for Great Examples of Collaborative Service Delivery
